title: Lego Minecraft Crafting Table Diorama Gets Huge Price Cut For Black Friday
description: Lego Minecraft: The Crafting Table (1,195 Pieces) $63 (was $90) | Retiring Soon See at Amazon See at Walmart See at Best Buy Sold out at Target Lego Minecraft: The Creeper (665 Pieces) $32 (was $40) See at Amazon See at Walmart See at Target If you're shopping for a Minecraft fan this holiday season, check out this awesome Black Friday deal on Lego's Crafting Table diorama. The 1,195-piece building set is on sale for only $63 (was $90) at Amazon, Walmart, and Best Buy. Lego is retiring The Crafting Table soon, so once this deal sells out, there's no guarantee retailers will replenish their inventory. It also happens to be the only Minecraft Lego set in the 18+ display model lineup for adult builders and collectors. The Crafting Table is the best Lego Minecraft deal during Black Friday week (so far), but fans can save on a bunch of other products in the collection, including the exceedingly popular 665-piece Creeper figure. We included a list of the best Lego Minecraft deals available now at the bottom of this article. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Dice Game Is Now Available IRL
description: Much like The Witcher 3's Gwent card game, Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2's dice game is now a collectible you can buy and play in real life. Farkle Dice wasn't an invention of the game's developer, Warhorse Studios, but it's fitting that Deliverance 2 has received a branded version of it that's available for purchase. If you've ever wanted to bring a bit of #KCD2 into real life... this farkle set exists outside the game - a full wooden board and dice, take it on trips, play it with friends. Link below! pic.twitter.com/ROuP4dOl55 — Warhorse Studios (@WarhorseStudios) November 24, 2025 The official Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 Farkle Dice set is sold by a company called Wulflund, and it isn't cheap. It's going for $151.38, and it comes with 12 wooden dice and a board made from wood and iron. Many of the strategies from GameSpot's guide to Farkle Dice games in Kingdom Come: Deliverance 2 are applicable to playing the game in real life. But it's still going to take some practice to fully understand the rules and how to play. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Solo Leveling: ARISE OVERDRIVE Is Available Right Now On Steam and Xbox PC
description: Embark on an all new adventure where you are Sung Jinwoo today.

title: Solo Leveling: ARISE OVERDRIVE Delivers A Gorgeous, High-Action Experience
description: The gates are open - and a new era of Hunters has arrived. Solo Leveling: ARISE OVERDRIVE brings the legendary rise of Sung Jinwoo to life like never before, capturing every ounce of heart, grit, and power that made Solo Leveling a global phenomenon. Available now on PC via Steam and Xbox PC, the game invites players to step into Jinwoo’s shoes and carve their own path from E-Rank underdog to unstoppable Shadow Monarch. With breathtaking visuals, cinematic storytelling, and exhilarating combat, this is Solo Leveling unleashed. What is Solo Leveling? Solo Leveling began as a breakout web novel that exploded into an award-winning Webtoon and anime. Fans gravitate to its fast-paced action, clean power progression, and the thrill of watching Sung Jinwoo rise from the weakest Hunter to a total powerhouse. His underdog-to-unstoppable journey is the heart of what made the IP a global phenomenon – and in Solo Leveling: ARISE OVERDRIVE, you get to step directly into that rise. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Real-Life Pokemon Mega Dimension Donuts Could Hint At Returning Legendary Pokemon
description: Pokemon Legends Z-A: Mega Dimension is set to launch next month, and excitement is already building as fans anticipate its Hoopa-focused storyline and the return of several classic Pokemon, including new Mega Evolutions. To mark the upcoming release, The Pokemon Company is partnering with the Pikachu Sweets Pokemon Cafe in Tokyo to introduce a themed menu inspired directly by the DLC's mysteries and motifs. These limited-time offerings aim to give fans a preview of what awaits in the expansion, in an edible form. The highlight of the promotion is a pair of striking new donuts, currently referred to only as the Red Donut and Blue Donut--names chosen to avoid spoilers before launch. Despite the intentionally vague labels, their designs unmistakably resemble Groudon and Kyogre, the legendary Pokemon featured on the covers of Pokemon Ruby and Pokemon Sapphire. The official website even playfully teases their origins with the line: "They look like some kind of Pokemon…?", suggesting that these real-world treats may hint at major Legendary appearances within the DLC itself. Image Credit: Pikachu SweetsThe Red Donut will have a strawberry and tea Flavor, with the Blue Donut having a banana and lemon flavor. Both cost 550 yen. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Fan Theories Link Pokemon Pokopia To Older Games In The Franchise
description: When it was announced in September 2025, Pokemon Pokopia appeared to be the franchise's cozy-game answer to Animal Crossing and Minecraft. But after the recently released extended trailer for the game, fans have pointed out intriguing and dark links to some of the previous titles in the franchise. It's almost unsettling that one of the first things seen in the extended trailer is a devastated Pokemon Center and a generation-one Pokedex. As noted on Reddit (via Eurogamer), one of the fan theories suggests that Pokopia is set on Cinnabar Island from the Kanto region, which was originally featured in Pokemon Blue, Red, and Yellow. As depicted in Pokemon Gold, Silver, and Crystal, Cinnabar Island was devastated by a volcano eruption that left a Pokemon Center as one of the last remaining structures, much like the one glimpsed in Pokopia's trailer. Professor Tangrowth--a character introduced in the trailer--mentions that he hasn't seen humans in a long time, but the island has other evidence that people once lived there including roads and other buildings. The strange Pokemon variations introduced in the trailer--like the stark-white Pikachu known as Peakychu--may have been created at Cinnabar Island's Pokemon Mansion. Perhaps not coincidentally, Pokemon Mansion was the place where Ditto could be found in the original Pokemon games. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Take A Look At These Xbox Crocs And Marvel At The Wonder Of Them
description: Microsoft's next product category has emerged: shoes. More specifically, Microsoft is teaming up with Crocs, Inc. for a new line of Xbox-branded Crocs and themed Jibbitz. The shoes go on sale tomorrow, November 25, so you don't have to wait very long to get your feet into them. The $80 shoes have been "designed with gamers in mind," the company said. The individual black-and-green shoes are labeled "Player Left" and "Player Right," and include fixed joysticks and buttons on them, replicating the Xbox controller. Crocs will also sell a five-pack of Jibbitz charms, focused on Xbox franchises like Halo, Doom, Fallout, World of Warcraft, and Sea of Thieves. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Don't Expect Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet To Appear At The Game Awards - Report
description: A harmless prophecy turned into confusion about whether Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet would show up at The Game Awards next month. But the Naughty Dog title reportedly won't be seen at the show. Giant Bomb's Jeff Grubb confirmed that Intergalactic won't appear at The Game Awards in December. Additionally, Grubb also stated on X that Intergalactic isn't coming out in 2026. These details were discovered after a weird sort of telephone game played out on the internet, starting with a prediction about Intergalactic by Colin Moriarty, the Last Stand Media owner, who later addressed the situation on X over the weekend. Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet - Trailer, Story, Setting, And Everything Else We Know See More Earlier this year, Bloomberg's Jason Schreier also reported that Intergalatic's earliest release window is 2027. The next game from The Last of Us developer was unveiled at The Game Awards last year. Naughty Dog stated that work began on Intergalactic in 2020. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Internet (And Gaming) Icon Strong Bad Returns With New Email After Three Years
description: After three years of mysteriously absent email-checking, Strong Bad has finally smashed his boxing-gloved fists onto the keyboard once more, returning with a brand-new message for his loyal fans. And in true Strong Bad fashion, it's about robots--again--and this time they apparently want to discuss their favorite sauces. His comeback feels like stepping back into Free Country, USA itself: chaotic, ridiculous, and somehow still deeply important to a generation. It also offers the perfect opportunity to revisit the era when Strong Bad and the rest of the Homestar Runner cast broke out of browser windows and into full-fledged video games. The most defining gaming moment for the franchise came with the Telltale game Strong Bad’s Cool Game for Attractive People, a five-episode point-and-click adventure released throughout 2008. The game played like an interactive Homestar Runner cartoon, built in close collaboration with the Brothers Chaps, who supplied writing, design input, and voice work. Guiding Strong Bad through his latest harebrained schemes--from band competitions to clumsy attempts at political takeover--gave fans a new way to revel in the character's larger-than-life personality, all while exploring familiar territory like the House of Strong and Bubs' Concession Stand. A large part of the game's charm came from its faithfulness to the original Flash cartoons. While it followed Telltale's traditional adventure formula, the world was loaded with oddball interactions, surreal conversations, and puzzles that functioned less on logic and more on the internal rules of Homestar Runner's absurdity. Each episode came packed with extra features, such as bizarre arcade minigames, collectible Teen Girl Squad cards, and hidden Easter eggs that rewarded longtime fans who had practically memorized the old website. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Battlefield 6 Free Trial Start-Times Revealed, Here's When You Can Start Playing
description: Battlefield Studios has announced a free trial for Battlefield 6, taking place over the Thanksgiving break for people in the US. The free trial runs November 25 through December 2, and it'll feature a sampling of the full game, including five modes and three maps (these were not specified, however). The free trial will be available across all platforms: PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC. Battlefield 6 free trial start-times The free trail begins November 25 at 4 AM PT / 7 AM ET. It ends at the same time on December 2. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Assassin's Creed Exceeded Expectations For Ubisoft, Mirage Hits 10 Million Players
description: The Assassin's Creed series "exceeded" Ubisoft's expectations for the latest quarter, the French publisher has confirmed, while also providing updates on the success of the last two big games, Mirage and Shadows. In its latest earnings briefing, Ubisoft said the Assassin's Creed series overall "posted a strong performance" in the latest quarter, including sales of the newest game, Shadows, and back-catalog titles. The Assassin's Creed series had more than 211 million "session days" so far in 2025, which is about 35% higher than the average for the past two years, Ubisoft said. Ubisoft added that the recent launch of the New Game+ mode for Shadows benefitted the game, as did the Claws of Awaji expansion. The publisher said the game now stands to "reach a broader audience" when it releases for Nintendo Switch 2 on December 2. Continue Reading at GameSpot
